IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ETHEL WALKER SCHOOL IS AN INDEPENDENT, COLLEGE PREPARATORY, BOARDING AND DAY SCHOOL FOR GIRLS IN GRADES SIX THROUGH TWELVE. SINCE 1911, THE ETHEL WALKER SCHOOL HAS EXCELLED AT PREPARING STUDENTS TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN THE WORLD. MEMBERS OF THIS DIVERSE COMMUNITY ARE DEDICATED TO SCHOLARSHIP, THE ARTS, ATHLETICS, WELLNESS, AND SERVICE. THE SATISFACTION OF ACHIEVEMENT AND JOY OF FRIENDSHIP ARE FUNDAMENTAL PRINCIPLES AS THE SCHOOL EMPOWERS GIRLS TO LEAD WITH INTEGRITY, CONFIDENCE, COURAGE, AND CONVICTION.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ETHEL WALKER SCHOOL IS AN INDEPENDENT, COLLEGE PREPARATORY, BOARDING AND DAY SCHOOL FOR GIRLS IN GRADES SIX THROUGH TWELVE. SINCE 1911, THE ETHEL WALKER SCHOOL HAS EXCELLED AT PREPARING STUDENTS TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN THE WORLD. MEMBERS OF THIS DIVERSE COMMUNITY ARE DEDICATED TO SCHOLARSHIP, THE ARTS, ATHLETICS, WELLNESS, AND SERVICE. THE SATISFACTION OF ACHIEVEMENT AND JOY OF FRIENDSHIP ARE FUNDAMENTAL PRINCIPLES AS THE SCHOOL EMPOWERS GIRLS TO LEAD WITH INTEGRITY, CONFIDENCE, COURAGE, AND CONVICTION.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUCTION OF STUDENTS AND SUPPORT SERVICES FOR INSTRUCTION PROGRAMS

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: FLIK INTERNATIONAL CORP COMPASS GROUP U

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN A CHARITABLE TRUST HELD BY THIRD PARTY
BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN CHARITABLE AND PERPETUAL TRUSTS

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: FAIR VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT FUND CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 90 INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES.
SCHOLARSHIPS AND TUITION ASSISTANCE -5,314,416. CHANGE IN BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN TRUSTS 760,000. RENTAL EXPENSES 2,138. UNREALIZED LOSS ON INTEREST RATE SWAP -800,453. ROUNDING 2.
ETHEL WALKER SCHOOL ADVERTISES IN BOTH INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PUBLICATIONS ITS POLICY OF NONDISCRIMINATION ON THE BASIS OF RACE, COLOR, RELIGION, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN.
FINANCIAL AID IS PROVIDED VIA A REDUCTION OF THE TUITION CHARGES.
CERTAIN EMPLOYEES, INCLUDING THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, ARE REQUIRED TO LIVE ON CAMPUS AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT.
ELIZABETH SPEERS, THE FORMER HEAD OF SCHOOL, PARTICIPATED IN A NON-QUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN, AND RECEIVED A PAYOUT FROM THE PLAN OF $50,000 OF DEFERRED COMPENSATION DURING THE YEAR.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: STATE OF CT HEALTH AND EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES AUTHORITY

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: CONSTRUCTION OF NEW DORM AND OTHER CAPITAL MAINTENANCE PROJECTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NO FUNDS WERE SUBJECT TO THE REBATE CALCULATION.
THE SCHOOL USES A BROKER TO SELL GIFTS OF SECURITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF THE ETHEL WALKER SCHOOL DIRECTS THAT THE FISCAL MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE REVIEW AND APPROVE THE FINAL VERSION WITH FULL AUTHORITY OF THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TRUSTEE AND KEY EMPLOYEES NEED TO COMPLETE AN ANNUAL DISCLOSURE FORM WHICH IS REVIEWED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL ENGAGED AN OUTSIDE CONSULTANT, HUGH MALLON, FOR A THREE YEAR CONTRACT REVIEW TO DETERMINE HEAD OF SCHOOL COMPENSATION. THIS WAS THE THIRD AND FINAL YEAR OF THE CONTRACT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
